meanings.definition: To carry or drag something heavy with difficulty.
meanings.sent1: She lugged the heavy suitcase up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: He lugged the groceries from the car to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The little girl lugged her oversized backpack comically.
meanings.sent4: He lugged his emotional baggage everywhere he went.
meanings.sent5: The old man lugged the treasure chest with great effort.

meanings.definition: To pull or haul something with force.
meanings.sent1: The workers lugged the heavy boxes onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: She lugged the stubborn donkey along the path.
meanings.sent3: The team lugged the giant pumpkin in a funny race.
meanings.sent4: He lugged his opponent across the finish line in the tug-of-war.
meanings.sent5: The tractor lugged the fallen tree out of the way.

meanings.definition: To transport or move something awkwardly or laboriously.
meanings.sent1: They lugged the sofa through the narrow doorway.
meanings.sent2: The students lugged their heavy backpacks to school.
meanings.sent3: The penguin lugged the fish clumsily across the ice.
meanings.sent4: She lugged her emotions around like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The ants lugged the food back to their nest tirelessly.
